title: How to Win a Strategy Based Video Game

steps.headline: Recognize that in most strategy games, you begin with a limited number of forces under your control, or units.
steps.description: First, you must utilize whatever method you have at your disposal to create more units (these methods are called generators). Click or press whatever the game says to create more units.

steps.headline: Once the creation of more units is underway, it would be wise to place your starting units at whatever entrance to your area there is.
steps.description: If there is more than one entrance to your turf, than split your units evenly among the weak spots. If this makes your units too thin, than place most of them at the largest entrance.

steps.headline: Once your units have been posted on "guard duty",then the enemy will most likely be arriving at your base momentarily.
steps.description: While your units are being created, focus on the more uncommon units (Ones that have special attacks, or abilities, such as explosions and the ability to regenerate your units.

steps.headline: When the enemy arrives, the true defense begins.
steps.description: Your guards will be the first to attack, so reinforce them with your other units.

steps.headline: Attack the enemy's special units with your weaker ones, as long as your weaker, more common units are numerous.
Send your specialized, tougher units to attack the weaker units of your opponent.
If all goes well, and your numbers match that of your opponent, victory should be not too far away.

text: Recognize that in most strategy games, you begin with a limited number of forces under your control, or units. First, you must utilize whatever method you have at your disposal to create more units (these methods are called generators). Click or press whatever the game says to create more units. Once the creation of more units is underway, it would be wise to place your starting units at whatever entrance to your area there is. If there is more than one entrance to your turf, than split your units evenly among the weak spots. If this makes your units too thin, than place most of them at the largest entrance. Once your units have been posted on "guard duty",then the enemy will most likely be arriving at your base momentarily. While your units are being created, focus on the more uncommon units (Ones that have special attacks, or abilities, such as explosions and the ability to regenerate your units. When the enemy arrives, the true defense begins. Your guards will be the first to attack, so reinforce them with your other units. Attack the enemy's special units with your weaker ones, as long as your weaker, more common units are numerous.  Send your specialized, tougher units to attack the weaker units of your opponent.  If all goes well, and your numbers match that of your opponent, victory should be not too far away.
